   19: %%
   20: -module(error_logger_h_SUITE).
   21: -export([all/0, suite/0,groups/0,init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1,
   22: 	 init_per_group/2,end_per_group/2]).
   23: -export([logfile/1,logfile_truncated/1,tty/1,tty_truncated/1]).
   24: 
   25: %% Event handler exports.
   26: -export([init/1,handle_event/2,terminate/2]).
   27: 
   28: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   29: 
   30: suite() -> [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]}].
   31: 
   32: all() ->
   33:     [logfile,logfile_truncated,tty,tty_truncated].
   34: 
   35: groups() ->
   36:     [].
   37: 
   38: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   39:     Config.
   40: 
   41: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
   42:     ok.
   43: 
   44: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   45:     Config.
   46: 
   47: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   48:     Config.
   49: 
   50: logfile(Config) ->
   51:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
   52:     LogDir = filename:join(PrivDir, ?MODULE),
   53:     Log = filename:join(LogDir, "logfile.log"),
   54:     ok = filelib:ensure_dir(Log),
   55: 
   56:     FileIOServers = file_io_servers(),
   57: 
   58:     Ev = event_templates(),
   59: 
   60:     do_one_logfile(Log, Ev, unlimited),
   61: 
   62:     {ok,Peer,Node} = ?CT_PEER(),
   63:     error_logger:logfile({open,Log}),
   64:     ok = rpc:call(Node, erlang, apply, [fun gen_events/1,[Ev]]),
   65:     AtNode = iolist_to_binary(["** at node ",atom_to_list(Node)," **"]),
   66:     timer:sleep(1000), % some time get all log events in the log
   67:     error_logger:logfile(close),
   68:     analyse_events(Log, Ev, [AtNode], unlimited),
   69: 
   70:     %% Make sure that the file_io_server process has been stopped.
   71:     FileIOServers = file_io_servers(),
   72: 
   73:     peer:stop(Peer),
   74: 
   75:     cleanup(Log),
   76:     ok.
   77: 
   78: file_io_servers() ->
   79:     [P || P <- processes(),
   80:           case process_info(P, [current_function]) of
   81:               [{current_function, {file_io_server, _, _}}] -> true;
   82:               _ -> false
   83:           end].
   84: 
   85: logfile_truncated(Config) ->
   86:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
   87:     LogDir = filename:join(PrivDir, ?MODULE),
   88:     Log = filename:join(LogDir, "logfile_truncated.log"),
   89:     ok = filelib:ensure_dir(Log),
   90: 
   91:     Ev = event_templates(),
   92: 
   93:     Depth = 20,
   94:     application:set_env(kernel, error_logger_format_depth, Depth),
   95:     try
   96: 	do_one_logfile(Log, Ev, Depth)
   97:     after
   98: 	application:unset_env(kernel, error_logger_format_depth)
   99:     end,
  100: 
  101:     cleanup(Log),
  102:     ok.
  103: 
  104: do_one_logfile(Log, Ev, Depth) ->
  105:     error_logger:logfile({open,Log}),
  106:     gen_events(Ev),
  107:     error_logger:logfile(close),
  108:     analyse_events(Log, Ev, [], Depth).
  109: 
  110: tty(Config) ->
  111:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  112:     LogDir = filename:join(PrivDir, ?MODULE),
  113:     Log = filename:join(LogDir, "tty.log"),
  114:     ok = filelib:ensure_dir(Log),
  115: 
  116:     Ev = event_templates(),
  117: 
  118:     do_one_tty(Log, Ev, unlimited),
  119: 
  120:     {ok,Peer,Node} = ?CT_PEER(),
  121:     tty_log_open(Log),
  122:     ok = rpc:call(Node, erlang, apply, [fun gen_events/1,[Ev]]),
  123:     tty_log_close(),
  124:     AtNode = iolist_to_binary(["** at node ",atom_to_list(Node)," **"]),
  125:     timer:sleep(1000), % some time get all log events in the log
  126:     analyse_events(Log, Ev, [AtNode], unlimited),
  127: 
  128:     peer:stop(Peer),
  129: 
  130:     cleanup(Log),
  131:     ok.
  132: 
  133: tty_truncated(Config) ->
  134:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  135:     LogDir = filename:join(PrivDir, ?MODULE),
  136:     Log = filename:join(LogDir, "tty_truncated.log"),
  137:     ok = filelib:ensure_dir(Log),
  138: 
  139:     Ev = event_templates(),
  140: 
  141:     Depth = 20,
  142:     application:set_env(kernel, error_logger_format_depth, Depth),
  143:     try
  144:        do_one_tty(Log, Ev, Depth)
  145:     after
  146: 	application:unset_env(kernel, error_logger_format_depth)
  147:     end,
  148: 
  149:     cleanup(Log),
  150:     ok.
  151: 
  152: do_one_tty(Log, Ev, Depth) ->
  153:     tty_log_open(Log),
  154:     gen_events(Ev),
  155:     tty_log_close(),
  156:     analyse_events(Log, Ev, [], Depth).
  157: 
  158: tty_log_open(Log) ->
  159:     {ok,Fd} = file:open(Log, [write]),
  160:     Depth = case application:get_env(kernel, error_logger_format_depth) of
  161: 		{ok,D} -> D;
  162: 		_ -> unlimited
  163: 	    end,
  164:     error_logger:add_report_handler(?MODULE, {Fd,Depth,latin1}),
  165:     Fd.
  166: 
  167: tty_log_close() ->
  168:     error_logger:delete_report_handler(?MODULE),
  169:     ok.
  170: 
  171: event_templates() ->
  172:     [{error_msg,["Pure error string\n",[]]},
  173:      {error_msg,["Pure error string with error ~p\n",[]]},
  174:      {error_msg,["Error string with ~p\n", [format]]},
  175:      {error_msg,["Error string with bad format ~p\n", []]},
  176: 
  177:      {error_report,[error_atom]},
  178:      {error_report,["error string"]},
  179:      {error_report,[[{error_tag,value},error_value]]},
  180: 
  181:      {info_msg,["Pure info string\n",[]]},
  182:      {info_msg,["Pure info string with error ~p\n",[]]},
  183:      {info_msg,["Pure string with ~p\n", [format]]},
  184:      {info_msg,["Pure string with bad format ~p\n", []]},
  185: 
  186:      {info_report,[info_atom]},
  187:      {info_report,["info string"]},
  188:      {info_report,[[{info_tag,value},info_value]]},
  189: 
  190:      {warning_msg,["Pure warning string\n",[]]},
  191:      {warning_msg,["Pure warning string with error ~p\n",[]]},
  192:      {warning_msg,["Warning string with ~p\n", [format]]},
  193:      {warning_msg,["Warning string with bad format ~p\n", []]},
  194: 
  195:      {warning_report,[warning_atom]},
  196:      {warning_report,["warning string"]},
  197:      {warning_report,[[{warning_tag,value},warning_value]]},
  198: 
  199:      %% Bigger terms.
  200:      {error_msg,["fairly big: ~p\n",[lists:seq(1, 128)]]},
  201:      {error_report,[list_to_tuple(lists:seq(1, 100))]},
  202:      {error_report,[lists:seq(32, 126)]},
  203:      {error_report,[[{tag,lists:seq(1, 64)}]]}
  204:     ].
  205: 
  206: gen_events(Ev) ->
  207:     io:format("node = ~p\n", [node()]),
  208:     io:format("group leader = ~p\n", [group_leader()]),
  209:     io:format("~p\n", [error_logger:which_report_handlers()]),
  210:     call_error_logger(Ev),
  211: 
  212:     {Pid,Ref} = spawn_monitor(fun() -> error(ouch) end),
  213:     receive
  214: 	{'DOWN',Ref,process,Pid,_} ->
  215: 	    ok
  216:     end,
  217: 
  218:     %% The following calls with a custom type will be ignored.
  219:     error_logger:error_report(ignored, value),
  220:     error_logger:warning_report(ignored, value),
  221:     error_logger:info_report(ignored, value),
  222:     receive after 100 -> ok end,
  223:     ok.
  224: 
  225: analyse_events(Log, Ev, AtNode, Depth) ->
  226:     {ok,Bin} = file:read_file(Log),
  227: 
  228:     io:format("*** Contents of log file ***\n\n~s\n", [Bin]),
  229: 
  230:     Lines = binary:split(Bin, <<"\n">>, [global,trim_all]),
  231:     io:format("~p\n", [Lines]),
  232: 
  233:     Rest = match_output(Ev, Lines, AtNode, Depth),
  234:     io:format("~p\n", [Rest]),
  235: 
  236:     [] = match_emulator_error(Rest),
  237:     ok.
  238: 
  239: 
  240: call_error_logger([{F,Args}|T]) ->
  241:     apply(error_logger, F, Args),
  242:     timer:sleep(10),
  243:     call_error_logger(T);
  244: call_error_logger([]) -> ok.
  245: 
  246: 
  247: match_emulator_error([Head,Second,Third,_|Lines]) ->
  248:     match_head(<<"ERROR">>, Head),
  249:     {match,[{0,_}]} = re:run(Second,
  250: 			   "^Error in process <\\d+[.]\\d+[.]\\d+> on "
  251: 			   "node [^ ]* with exit value:"),
  252:     {match,[{0,_}]} = re:run(Third, "^[{]ouch,"),
  253:     Lines.
  254: 
  255: match_output([Item|T], Lines0, AtNode, Depth) ->
  256:     try match_item(Item, Lines0, AtNode, Depth) of
  257: 	Lines ->
  258: 	    match_output(T, Lines, AtNode, Depth)
  259:     catch
  260: 	C:E:Stk ->
  261: 	    io:format("ITEM: ~p", [Item]),
  262: 	    io:format("LINES: ~p", [Lines0]),
  263: 	    erlang:raise(C, E, Stk)
  264:     end;
  265: match_output([], Lines, _, _) -> Lines.
  266: 
  267: match_item(Item, Lines, AtNode, Depth) ->
  268:     case item_type(Item) of
  269: 	{msg,Head,Args} ->
  270: 	    match_format(Head, Args, Lines, AtNode, Depth);
  271: 	{report,Head,Args} ->
  272: 	    match_term(Head, Args, Lines, AtNode, Depth)
  273:     end.
  274: 
  275: item_type({error_msg,Args}) ->
  276:     {msg,<<"ERROR">>,Args};
  277: item_type({info_msg,Args}) ->
  278:     {msg,<<"INFO">>,Args};
  279: item_type({warning_msg,Args}) ->
  280:     {msg,<<"WARNING">>,Args};
  281: item_type({error_report,Args}) ->
  282:     {report,<<"ERROR">>,Args};
  283: item_type({info_report,Args}) ->
  284:     {report,<<"INFO">>,Args};
  285: item_type({warning_report,Args}) ->
  286:     {report,<<"WARNING">>,Args}.
  287: 
  288: match_format(Tag, [Format,Args], [Head|Lines], AtNode, Depth) ->
  289:     match_head(Tag, Head),
  290:     Bin = try dl_format(Depth, Format, Args) of
  291: 	      Str ->
  292: 		  iolist_to_binary(Str)
  293:     catch
  294: 	_:_ ->
  295: 	    S = dl_format(Depth, "ERROR: ~p - ~p~n", [Format,Args]),
  296: 	    iolist_to_binary(S)
  297:     end,
  298:     Expected0 = binary:split(Bin, <<"\n">>, [global,trim]),
  299:     Expected = AtNode ++ Expected0,
  300:     match_term_lines(Expected, Lines).
  301: 
  302: match_term(Tag, [Arg], [Head|Lines], AtNode, Depth) ->
  303:     match_head(Tag, Head),
  304:     Expected0 = match_term_get_expected(Arg, Depth),
  305:     Expected = AtNode ++ Expected0,
  306:     match_term_lines(Expected, Lines).
  307: 
  308: match_term_get_expected(List, Depth) when is_list(List) ->
  309:     Bin = try iolist_to_binary(dl_format(Depth, "~s\n", [List])) of
  310: 	      Bin0 -> Bin0
  311: 	  catch
  312: 	      _:_ ->
  313: 		  iolist_to_binary(format_rep(List, Depth))
  314: 	  end,
  315:     binary:split(Bin, <<"\n">>, [global,trim]);
  316: match_term_get_expected(Term, Depth) ->
  317:     S = dl_format(Depth, "~p\n", [Term]),
  318:     Bin = iolist_to_binary(S),
  319:     binary:split(Bin, <<"\n">>, [global,trim]).
  320: 
  321: format_rep([{Tag,Data}|Rep], Depth) ->
  322:     [dl_format(Depth, "    ~p: ~p\n", [Tag,Data])|
  323:      format_rep(Rep, Depth)];
  324: format_rep([Other|Rep], Depth) ->
  325:     [dl_format(Depth, "    ~p\n", [Other])|
  326:      format_rep(Rep, Depth)];
  327: format_rep([], _Depth) -> [].
  328: 
  329: match_term_lines([Line|T], [Line|Lines]) ->
  330:     match_term_lines(T, Lines);
  331: match_term_lines([], Lines) -> Lines.
  332: 
  333: match_head(Tag, Head) ->
  334:     Re = <<"^=",Tag/binary,
  335: 	   " REPORT==== \\d\\d?-[A-Z][a-z][a-z]-\\d{4}::"
  336: 	   "\\d\\d:\\d\\d:\\d\\d ===$">>,
  337:     {match,_} = re:run(Head, Re).
  338: 
  339: cleanup(File) ->
  340:     %% The point of this test case is not to test file operations.
  341:     %% Therefore ignore any failures.
  342:     case file:delete(File) of
  343: 	ok ->
  344: 	    ok;
  345: 	{error,Error1} ->
  346: 	    io:format("file:delete(~s) failed with error ~p",
  347: 		      [File,Error1])
  348:     end,
  349:     Dir = filename:dirname(File),
  350:     case file:del_dir(Dir) of
  351: 	ok ->
  352: 	    ok;
  353: 	{error,Error2} ->
  354: 	    io:format("file:del_dir(~s) failed with error ~p",
  355: 		      [Dir,Error2])
  356:     end,
  357:     ok.
  358: 
  359: 
  360: %% Depth-limited io_lib:format. Intentionally implemented here instead
  361: %% of using io_lib:scan_format/2 to avoid using the same implementation
  362: %% as in the error_logger handlers.
  363: 
  364: dl_format(unlimited, Format, Args) ->
  365:     io_lib:format(Format, Args);
  366: dl_format(Depth, Format0, Args0) ->
  367:     {Format,Args} = dl_format_1(Format0, Args0, Depth, [], []),
  368:     io_lib:format(Format, Args).
  369: 
  370: dl_format_1("~p"++Fs, [A|As], Depth, Facc, Acc) ->
  371:     dl_format_1(Fs, As, Depth, [$P,$~|Facc], [Depth,A|Acc]);
  372: dl_format_1("~w"++Fs, [A|As], Depth, Facc, Acc) ->
  373:     dl_format_1(Fs, As, Depth, [$W,$~|Facc], [Depth,A|Acc]);
  374: dl_format_1("~s"++Fs, [A|As], Depth, Facc, Acc) ->
  375:     dl_format_1(Fs, As, Depth, [$s,$~|Facc], [A|Acc]);
  376: dl_format_1([F|Fs], As, Depth, Facc, Aacc) ->
  377:     dl_format_1(Fs, As, Depth, [F|Facc], Aacc);
  378: dl_format_1([], [], _, Facc, Aacc) ->
  379:     {lists:reverse(Facc),lists:reverse(Aacc)}.
  380: 
  381: %%%
  382: %%% Our own event handler. There is no way to intercept the output
  383: %%% from error_logger_tty_h, but we can use the same code by
  384: %%% calling error_logger_tty_h:write_event/2.
  385: %%%
  386: 
  387: init({_,_,_}=St) ->
  388:     {ok,St}.
  389: 
  390: handle_event(Event, {Fd,Depth,Enc}=St) ->
  391:     case error_logger_tty_h:write_event(tag_event(Event), io_lib, {Depth,Enc}) of
  392: 	ok ->
  393: 	    ok;
  394: 	Str when is_list(Str) ->
  395: 	    io:put_chars(Fd, Str)
  396:     end,
  397:     {ok,St}.
  398: 
  399: terminate(_Reason, {Fd,_,_}) ->
  400:     ok = file:close(Fd),
  401:     [].
  402: 
  403: tag_event(Event) ->
  404:     {erlang:universaltime(),Event}.
